intro: Oxylaena, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Oxylaena thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and landscapes.
